STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 28, 2023
Karen LEE Southgate
LAPEER COUNTY DHHS
1505 SUNCREST DR,
LAPEER, MI, 48446-1137
RE: License#: CP440201239
Dear Karen LEE Southgate:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/25/2023. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• None
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted a corrective action plan for the interim evaluation completed
9/30/2022. The only area in noncompliance was FOM 722-06 B. The corrective
action plan was received 10/19/22 and approved 10/21/22. There were no repeat
noncompliance or other areas of noncompliance indicated as a part of this renewal
evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the corrective action plan for
the interim evaluation completed 9/30/22. It also included a review of the agency's
compliance with key performance indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences and no areas of
concern were noted.
Youth interviews with the analyst were positive in nature and indicated appropriate
services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is well maintained, and the record storage is consistent and is in
compliance with licensing requirements.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts and comments from caregivers and youth were positive
and indicated appropriate support services are being provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.

8/28/2023
